trans-unit.source: Provides data for the <xref href="System.Windows.VisualStateGroup.CurrentStateChanging"></xref> and <xref href="System.Windows.VisualStateGroup.CurrentStateChanged"></xref> events.

When the <xref:System.Windows.VisualStateGroup> that raises the event is set on the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ControlTemplate> of a control, the <xref:System.Windows.VisualStateChangedEventArgs.Control%2A> property is the control that owns the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ControlTemplate>.

When the <xref:System.Windows.VisualStateGroup> is set on a <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement> that is not in a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ControlTemplate>, the <xref:System.Windows.VisualStateChangedEventArgs.Control%2A> property is `null` and you should use the <xref:System.Windows.VisualStateChangedEventArgs.StateGroupsRoot%2A> property.
Gets the element that is transitioning states.

When the <xref:System.Windows.VisualStateGroup> is set on a <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement> that is not in a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ControlTemplate>, the Control property is `null` and you should use the <xref:System.Windows.VisualStateChangedEventArgs.StateGroupsRoot%2A> property.

The element that is transitioning states if the <xref href="System.Windows.VisualStateGroup"></xref> is in a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ControlTemplate"></xref>; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
Gets the state that the element is transitioning to or has transitioned to.
The state that the element is transitioning to or has transitioned to.
Gets the state that the element is transitioning to or has transitioned from.
The state that the element is transitioning to or has transitioned from.
Gets the root element that contains the <xref href="System.Windows.VisualStateManager"></xref>.
The root element that contains the <xref href="System.Windows.VisualStateManager"></xref>.
